title: How to Put up an A Frame Tent

steps.headline: Gather the things you will need.
Pick a Good Location
steps.description:
The ideal location to pitch an A Frame tent would be on a flat surface. As well as a flat surface, try to find a spot with a higher elevation than the surrounding area. The purpose of doing this is in case it rains or floods, the water will not all drain down into your tent. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Prepare the Area
steps.description: Clear away any sticks, stones, pieces of glass or other sharp materials that may cause your tent to rip.

steps.headline: Lay Your Tent Out
steps.description: Spread the tent out on the ground where you plan on setting it up.

steps.headline: Peg Your Tent Out
steps.description:
Secure the inner part of the tent to the ground by inserting a peg through each one of the loops find on the corners of the tent. When hammering your pegs into the ground be sure that the fabric is stretched tight. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5f\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5f\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Assemble the Poles
steps.description:
Connect the pole segments together. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Erect the Tent
steps.description:
Placing one pole in the top corner of the tent at one end, wedge it vertically into the ground. While in position, pull on the guy rope to suspend the pole where it is. Pull the guy rope as far as you can away from the tent, as this will make your tent more secure. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Flysheet
steps.description:
Throw the flysheet over the entire tent, aligning the corners with the pole. Pull the end guy ropes out and secure them. peg the other guy ropes in place. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/17\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/1\/17\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Final Check
steps.description: Step back and make sure that your tent looks as if it has been setup correctly!

tyn: mallet to hammer in the pegs
text:
Gather the things you will need. Pick a Good Location The ideal location to pitch an A Frame tent would be on a flat surface. As well as a flat surface, try to find a spot with a higher elevation than the surrounding area. The purpose of doing this is in case it rains or floods, the water will not all drain down into your tent. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/4/4a/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

Lay Your Tent Out Spread the tent out on the ground where you plan on setting it up. Peg Your Tent Out Secure the inner part of the tent to the ground by inserting a peg through each one of the loops find on the corners of the tent. When hammering your pegs into the ground be sure that the fabric is stretched tight. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/5f/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

sentences: Gather the things you will need.
Pick a Good Location The ideal location to pitch an A Frame tent would be on a flat surface.
As well as a flat surface, try to find a spot with a higher elevation than the surrounding area.
The purpose of doing this is in case it rains or floods, the water will not all drain down into your tent.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Prepare the Area Clear away any sticks, stones, pieces of glass or other sharp materials that may cause your tent to rip.
Lay Your Tent Out Spread the tent out on the ground where you plan on setting it up.
Peg Your Tent Out Secure the inner part of the tent to the ground by inserting a peg through each one of the loops find on the corners of the tent.
When hammering your pegs into the ground be sure that the fabric is stretched tight.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5f\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5f\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Assemble the Poles Connect the pole segments together.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Erect the Tent Placing one pole in the top corner of the tent at one end, wedge it vertically into the ground.
While in position, pull on the guy rope to suspend the pole where it is.
Pull the guy rope as far as you can away from the tent, as this will make your tent more secure.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/08\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Flysheet Throw the flysheet over the entire tent, aligning the corners with the pole.
Pull the end guy ropes out and secure them.
peg the other guy ropes in place.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/17\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/1\/17\/Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/aid158989-v4-728px-Put-up-an-A-Frame-Tent-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Final Check Step back and make sure that your tent looks as if it has been setup correctly!
